thread.title: Man obsessed with Britney Spears spends more than £60,000 on plastic surgery to look like singer
thread.title_full: Man obsessed with Britney Spears spends more than £60,000 on plastic surgery to look like singer - Mirror Online

author: mirror.co.uk
title: Man obsessed with Britney Spears spends more than £60,000 on plastic surgery to look like singer
text:
Man obsessed with Britney Spears spends more than £60,000 on plastic surgery to look like singer Bryan Ray he has learned all her dance choreography and is even referred to as 'Britney' by his friends Share Comments By Josh Saunders 10:19, 2 FEB 2017 Updated 10:23, 2 FEB 2017 News Bryan Ray, before his transformation, during a chance encounter with Britney Spears (Photo: Caters) A Britney Spears fanatic is so obsessed with the pop star that he's spent more than £60,000 on plastic surgery, veneers and Botox injections to look just like her.
Bryan Ray started emulating the 'Baby One More Time' singer at 17, when he had veneers to match her smile, but has now had more than 90 cosmetic procedures .
The 31-year-old has spent a small fortune on a nose job, fat injections in his cheeks, laser hair removal, lip fillers, Botox and more.
But he's not just copying the 35-year-old star's appearance - he has learned all her dance choreography, performs in nightclubs as a tribute act and is even referred to as 'Britney' by his friends.
Bryan has had more than 90 cosmetic procedures (Photo: Caters) Bryan, from Los Angeles, said Britney is 'perfection' in his eyes and she helped him to understand himself while going through a hard time growing up.
Read More Britney Spears has X-rated wardrobe malfunction as her BOOB falls out during live performance He splashes almost £400 a month on lotions to keep his skin looking youthful.
Bryan, who runs a marijuana edibles company, said: "I love making modifications to my face and body with the art of plastic surgery, fillers & countless other cosmetic procedures.
"Ever since I was young there was something about Britney Spears and the qualities she had that I thought was the perfect package.
"I was obsessed, I watched all her interviews, learned all her choreography and then paid to have the same perfect smile as, I felt that during that time we were very similar.
The 31-year-old has Botox injections every five months (Photo: Caters) "In the beginning, I was trying to look like Britney Spears, my surgeons who designed my veneers asked me which celebrity smile I wanted to base mine on and it was hers.
"Now with my looks, I want to get into modelling, I love impersonating Britney Spears so I want to continue doing that and see where it takes me.
"So many people refer to me as 'Britney' and for a very long time friends have greeted me with her infamous Quote: 'It's Britney, b****' from her song 'Gimme More' which I absolutely love."
Bryan continues to dress up and make music videos while lip syncing to her songs.
He has met his idol three times, and recalled an encounter at a market in Hawaii and another in 2007 when the singer was having a public meltdown and being hounded by paparazzi.
Bryan is pictured before he had any surgery (Photo: Caters) He said: "I've never been more nervous, I was face to face with my biggest idol and inspiration, she was completely not glammed stripped of make-up, very real and so gorgeous.
Read More Ex On The Beach's Laura-Alicia Summers gets sixth boob job after revealing wonky breasts on Botched Up Bodies "My eyes zoomed in on her teeth, they were just as beautiful in her photos and music videos, she was the sweetest person.
"The next time I met her she was going through a dark period and was speaking in a British accent while waiting in line at a pharmacy, she acknowledged me but wasn't too friendly.
"Then I also met her again at a club called Tiger Heat in the VIP lounge when she was there with her boyfriend of the time, where she was very sweet."
The self-confessed 'human doll' believes he doesn't look 'a day over 17' thanks to his routine of laser hair treatment every two months, Botox every five months and lip fillers four times a year.
Bryan (right) with Marcela Iglesias, a producer of Plastics of Hollywood (Photo: Caters) Bryan said: "One of my primary goals is to preserve my youth for as long as possible, I don't want any facial or body hair as it will age me.
"I've fully avoided wrinkles, Botox has been my best friend throughout my journey to prevent aging, even today people think I'm younger than I am.
"I'm very proud of my age, when people ask me how old I am, I tell them the truth because I'm not ashamed and have been on this journey since I was 17.
"I also have a full skin care routine and stay out of the sun completely, thanks to it all I've managed not to age at all and maintain my youth."
Bryan is set to features in new show tentatively called "Plastics of Hollywood", based on a talent and modelling agency for real life human dolls.
 More On Britney Spears Cosmetic surgery Plastic surgery Celebrity hairstyles Botox Beauty products
